## IStateSyncConfig interface

Config for setting up state syncing with 

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface IStateSyncConfig<State extends BaseState, StateStorage extends IStateStorage = IStateStorage> 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [stateContainer](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-plugins-opensearch_dashboard_utils-public-state_sync.istatesyncconfig.statecontainer.md) | <code>INullableBaseStateContainer&lt;State&gt;</code> | State container to keep in sync with storage, have to implement [INullableBaseStateContainer](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-plugins-opensearch_dashboard_utils-public-state_sync.inullablebasestatecontainer.md) interface We encourage to use  as a state container, but it is also possible to implement own custom container for advanced use cases |
|  [stateStorage](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-plugins-opensearch_dashboard_utils-public-state_sync.istatesyncconfig.statestorage.md) | <code>StateStorage</code> | State storage to use, State storage is responsible for serialising / deserialising and persisting / retrieving stored state<!-- -->There are common strategies already implemented: see [IOsdUrlStateStorage](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-plugins-opensearch_dashboard_utils-public-state_sync.iosdurlstatestorage.md) which replicate what State (AppState, GlobalState) in legacy world did |
|  [storageKey](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-plugins-opensearch_dashboard_utils-public-state_sync.istatesyncconfig.storagekey.md) | <code>string</code> | Storage key to use for syncing, e.g. storageKey '\_a' should sync state to ?\_a query param |
